title: Hukou Waterfall a wonder for autumn tourists
text:
By Sun Ruisheng and Zhou Huiying | chinadaily.com.cn | Updated: 2019-10-11 16:46

Visitors view Hukou Waterfall, part of the Yellow River in Jixian county, North China's Shanxi province.[Photo by Lyu Guiming for chinadaily.com.cn]

In recent sunny autumn days, Hukou Waterfall, part of the Yellow River in Jixian county, North China's Shanxi province, has attracted lots of tourists.

It provides a spectacular scene for people to view the rushing water cascading over the edges of rocks.

Located on the border of North China's Shanxi and Northwest China's Shaanxi provinces, Hukou Waterfall is the second-largest waterfall in China and the largest one on the Yellow River.
